------=_Part_184830_538727562.1438662520931
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

My implementation represents the neurons as callable functions, and I do a =
sorting on the basis of activation sequence, so in effect, RubyNEAT is also=
 a type of GP as much as it is a TWEANN. I did it this way to get the great=
est performance out of Ruby, which would otherwise be too slow to do someth=
ing like this.
Not sure how the other implementations approach this.
I am a=
lso retooling RubyNEAT to use AMQP to express and evaluate the TWEANNs on r=
emote machines. The evaluations can be done in any language of your choice =
on as many machines you like...
And yes, I am keeping a sharp eye out from =
that little red dot from Sarah Conner's rifle sights. :)=C2=A0=C2=A0

Kind =
Regards,

Fred Mitchell,=C2=A0


+49 (0)15 259 409475, Skype: flajann
 


 =
    On Tuesday, 4 August 2015, 4:57, "bbjprizes@... [neat]" <neat@yah=
oogroups.com> wrote:
   

 =C2=A0   Thank you both for your input. =C2=A0Ri=
ght now I'm just trying to get the XOR experiment working. One of the probl=
ems I'm trying to overcome is the execution order of the neurons when I gen=
erate the network. Quick example. Node 1 is an input and node 2 is the outp=
ut, so gene 1 is from 1->2. =C2=A0But if a hidden nodes get added, node 3, =
which is between 1 and 2 the genes are now 1->3 and 3->2 but when I generat=
e my network neuron 1 has a link from 3->2 =C2=A0( at which point neuron 2 =
has not been calculated).
Do the neurons need to be sorted? =C2=A0Again mos=
t of the examples I've found loop through the neurons and sum the inputs, b=
ut that would again assume the neurons are in the correct order.
Thanks aga=

      <div>Thank you both for your input.  Right n=
ow I'm just trying to get the XOR experiment working. One of the problems I=
'm trying to overcome is the execution order of the neurons when I generate=
 the network. Quick example. Node 1 is an input and node 2 is the output, s=
o gene 1 is from 1->2.  But if a hidden nodes get added, node 3, wh=
ich is between 1 and 2 the genes are now 1->3 and 3->2 but when I gen=
erate my network neuron 1 has a link from 3->2  ( at which point ne=
uron 2 has not been calculated).</div><div><br clear=3D"none"></div><div>Do=
 the neurons need to be sorted?  Again most of the examples I've found=
 loop through the neurons and sum the inputs, but that would again assume t=
he neurons are in the correct order.</div><div><br clear=3D"none"></div><di=
v>Thanks again.</div>

    </div>
